meanings.definition: A type of fruitcake traditionally eaten in Ireland.
meanings.sent1: During the Irish festival, families enjoy a slice of barnbrack together.
meanings.sent2: At the bakery, customers often ask for a slice of barnbrack with their tea.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun swapped the gold coin for a piece of barnbrack.
meanings.sent4: The barnbrack on the table was a symbol of the holiday spirit.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked barnbrack filled the room with warmth.

meanings.definition: A sweet bread containing dried fruit, typically served at Halloween.
meanings.sent1: Children eagerly wait to receive a slice of barnbrack while trick-or-treating.
meanings.sent2: The barnbrack at the Halloween party was a hit among the guests.
meanings.sent3: The spooky ghost asked for a piece of barnbrack instead of candy.
meanings.sent4: The barnbrack glowed under the moonlight, adding to the eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the sugary barnbrack lingered on their tongues long after Halloween.

meanings.definition: A loaf of bread made with raisins or currants.
meanings.sent1: The bakery down the street sells delicious barnbrack loaves.
meanings.sent2: In the morning, she enjoyed a slice of warm barnbrack with butter.
meanings.sent3: The barnbrack loaf was so big, it barely fit in the breadbox.
meanings.sent4: The barnbrack bread was a delightful addition to the picnic spread.
meanings.sent5: The scent of freshly baked barnbrack filled the kitchen with a sweet aroma.
